maml:description.maml:para: Disables the specified user in Tridion Content Manager.

Disables the specified user in Tridion Content Manager, preventing the user from logging in or performing any actions. This action lasts until Enable-TridionUser is called or the user is explicitly enabled by other means (such as within the Content Manager Explorer).

maml:Description.maml:para: The user to disable. Either the TCM URI, WebDAV URL, or the user object itself.
If specified, the modified user is returned from the command.
If specified, the modified user is returned from the command.
The user to disable. Either the TCM URI, WebDAV URL, or the user object itself.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-TridionUser -Name 'EXAMPLE\isaacn' | Disable-TridionUser

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $user = Get-TridionUser -Id 'tcm:0-25-65552'; Disable-TridionUser -User $user

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Disable-TridionUser -User "tcm:0-25-65552"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-TridionUser -Name 'EXAMPLE\*' | Disable-TridionUser

dev:remarks.maml:para: Disables all users in the "EXAMPLE" domain.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-TridionUser -Name 'EXAMPLE\isaacn' | Disable-TridionUser -PassThru

dev:remarks.maml:para: Disables the user with username 'EXAMPLE\isaacn' and returns the updated user data.

maml:description.maml:para: Enables the specified user in Tridion Content Manager.
Enables the specified user in Tridion Content Manager, after he or she has previously been disabled.

maml:Description.maml:para: The user to enable. Either the TCM URI, WebDAV URL, or the user object itself.
If specified, the modified user is returned from the command.
If specified, the modified user is returned from the command.
The user to enable. Either the TCM URI, WebDAV URL, or the user object itself.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-TridionUser -Name 'EXAMPLE\isaacn' | Enable-TridionUser

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $user = Get-TridionUser -Id 'tcm:0-25-65552'; Enable-TridionUser -User $user

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Enable-TridionUser -User "tcm:0-25-65552"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-TridionUser -Name 'EXAMPLE\*' | Enable-TridionUser

dev:remarks.maml:para: Re-enables all users in the "EXAMPLE" domain.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-TridionUser -Name 'EXAMPLE\isaacn' | Enable-TridionUser -PassThru

dev:remarks.maml:para: Re-enables the user with username 'EXAMPLE\isaacn' and returns the updated user data.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the version of the Core Service API that is installed on the Content Manager.
Get the version of the Core Service API that is installed on the Content Manager.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-TridionApiVersion

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the version of the Core Service API that is installed on the Content Manager.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $web8OrLater = (Get-TridionApiVersion).Major -ge 8

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets a boolean variable indicating if the Content Manager is Web 8 or later.

maml:Description.maml:para: The parent organization item to query. Either the TCM URI, WebDAV URL, or the parent object itself.
If specified, also returns all child items in nested organizational items.
If specified, includes a Level property on each object to indicate the nested level of the item.
If specified, loads all properties for each entry in the list. By default, only some properties are loaded (for performance reasons).
If specified, loads all properties for each entry in the list. By default, only some properties are loaded (for performance reasons).
If specified, includes a Level property on each object to indicate the nested level of the item.
The parent organization item to query. Either the TCM URI, WebDAV URL, or the parent object itself.
If specified, also returns all child items in nested organizational items.

When omitted the current user will be executing all Tridion commands.

When omitted the current user will be executing all Tridion commands.
